result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Glenn D Chapman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #16CM902 and Case #15CF176.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Kelly Pingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marchan requests an adjournment as Defendant has a new charge coming through.  State does not object to request.  Court adjourns.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court with attorney John Paul Marchan.  Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Marchan requests to set for a jury trial. Court will set for jury trial on 15CM2031 with co-defendant on case. Bail remains as fixed.  Jury status hearing scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for May 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marchan requests an adjournment.    Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for February 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
(Fax) Discovery demand. Filed by Atty Marchan.

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court with Attorney John Paul Marchan.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Marchan requests an adjourned date due to new case.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with witnesses listed in the Criminal Complaint with the exception of his 2 brothers.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant Glenn D Chapman in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
